bug.author: danielhers
bug.summary: nlp.vocab.vectors.resize gives 'numpy.uint64' object is not iterable
bug.description:
Steps to reproduce: <denchmark-code>>>> import spacy >>> nlp = spacy.load("en_core_web_md") >>> nlp.vocab.vectors.resize((100,80)) Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "vectors.pyx", line 153, in spacy.vectors.Vectors.resize TypeError: 'numpy.uint64' object is not iterable </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>Info about spaCy</denchmark-h>
spaCy version: 2.0.1 Platform: Linux-4.10.0-38-generic-x86_64-with-Ubuntu-17.04-zesty Python version: 3.5.3 Models: en, en_core_web_md

comments.comment: Thanks! And even a release so I can use it already! Amazing.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/honnibal>@honnibal</denchmark-link> Spoke too soon :( Running the same example in 2.0.2 now gives <denchmark-code>Traceback (most recent call last): File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module> File "vectors.pyx", line 153, in spacy.vectors.Vectors.resize RuntimeError: dictionary changed size during iteration </denchmark-code>
This thread has been automatically locked since there has not been any recent activity after it was closed. Please open a new issue for related bugs.
